summary: This bill, the "Sustainable Cardiopulmonary Rehabilitation Services in the Home Act," aims to permanently extend in-home cardiopulmonary rehabilitation flexibilities established during the COVID-19 pandemic. It amends the Social Security Act to allow for in-home services delivered via telehealth, and expands originating sites for telehealth services. The bill also directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish standards for designating a patient's home as a provider-based organization, and to include cardiac and pulmonary rehabilitation programs among telehealth services.
